TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 1005
TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Samuel M Williams, 09-11-1833

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to Samuel M. Williams, Mexico, September 13, 1833. Reforms. Cholera. Land.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1005

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Samuel M. Williams, Mexico, September 13, 1833. Reforms. Cholera. Land.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*[From Williams Papers, Rosenberg Library, Galveston, Tex.*/p*]
*p* *date_mentioned n="09-11-1833">Septr. 11 1833*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*I have nothing important to say, more than what I have said in my letters by last mail, except that my opinion is strengthened since then, that the *date_mentioned n="04-06-1830">6 of april */date_mentioned*law will be repealed in ten days after *person_mentioned*congress */person_mentioned*meets. It is expected there will be a meeting *date_mentioned n="09-17-1833">next monday*/date_mentioned* (this is Wednesday). In fact I now have very little, or rather no doubts at all on this question. The mails and the reduction of duties will also be done, and the State matter will be sent to the *location_mentioned*other States*/location_mentioned* in a favourable shape to be speedily and favourably dispatched—so say the most *person_mentioned*influencial men in congress*/person_mentioned* and in the Govt. The revolution is not over and God knows when it will be—I fear not very soon—tho something decissive must take place shortly for the two *person_mentioned*armies */person_mentioned*are *location_mentioned*in the field */location_mentioned*again and near each other. The cholera is nearly over—*person_mentioned*20.000 dead*/person_mentioned* in this *location_mentioned*city */location_mentioned*as is said I think about 18000—it was horrible. Don't forget that *date_mentioned n="10-xx-1833">October */date_mentioned*is the limit for locating *location_mentioned*grants*/location_mentioned*—remember *person_mentioned*Padilla */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*H. Austin*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Victor Blanco*/person_mentioned* and collect my dues, give the notes to *person_mentioned*Perry*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. A*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Al sor *person_mentioned*Dr Samuel M. Williams administrador de correos en *location_mentioned*Austin*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
